channel.title: BBC News - Health
channel.description: The latest stories from the Health section of the BBC News web site.
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: VIDEO: How a new vaccine could eradicate polio
item.description: More than 150 countries are switching to a different vaccine to target polio.

item.title: VIDEO: 'I start forgetting stuff and that frightens me'
item.description: Elan Shoffman has Parkinson's disease, but he is determined to deliver a speech at his daughter's wedding.

item.title: VIDEO: Trapped in an institution for seven years
item.description: Debbie Evans talks about her son who has learning disabilities and has lived in a medical institution for seven years

item.title: VIDEO: Five-year-old's rotten teeth to be removed
item.description: Mother of two, Dr Rachel Maynard, tells the Victoria Derbyshire programme of her shock and embarrassment after discovering her five-year-old son needed two rotten teeth removed.

item.title: VIDEO: Children miss school due to poor teeth
item.description: More than 100 operations a day are being carried out in hospitals in England to remove rotten teeth from children and teenagers.
